gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry
Class Position3D_d

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry.Position3D_d
All Implemented Interfaces:
IXmlIO, java.io.Serializable
public class Position3D_d
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, IXmlIO

Position3D_d represents a double precision position in 3D space in cartesian, cylindrical and spherical coordinate systems. Methods are provided to get & set the position in all three of these coordinate systems. All angle parameters are specified and returned in radians.

See Also:
Serialized Form

getCartesianCoords

public double[] getCartesianCoords()
Get the position as a triple of values, (x, y, z) in Cartesian coordinates.

Returns:
Returns the x, y, z values for the point in positions 0, 1 and 2 respectively, of an array of doubles.

setSphericalCoords

                               double azimuth_angle,

Specify the position as a triple of values, (r, theata, phi) in spherical polar coordinates.

getSphericalCoords

public double[] getSphericalCoords()
Get the position as a triple of values, (r, theata, phi) in spherical polar coordinates.

Returns:
Returns the values of the radius, azimuth angle and polar angle in positions 0, 1 and 2 respectively, of an array of doubles.

getCylindricalCoords

public double[] getCylindricalCoords()
Get the position as a triple of values, (r, theata, z) in cylindrical coordinates.

Returns:
Returns the values of the radius, azimuth angle and z value in positions 0, 1 and 2 respectively, of an array of doubles.

getCenterOfMass

public static Position3D_d getCenterOfMass(Position3D_d[] points,
                                           double[] weights)
Calculate the weighted average of a list of 3D points, given a list of weights for the points. Any points for which a weight is not given will be given weight 0.

Parameters:
points - Array of Position3D_d objects whose weighted average is calculated
weights - Array of doubles giving the weights of the points.
Returns:
A point containing the weighted average of the specified points.

XMLwrite

public boolean XMLwrite(java.io.OutputStream stream,
                        int mode)
Implements the IXmlIO interface so a DetectoPositon can write itself

Specified by:
XMLwrite in interface IXmlIO
Parameters:
stream - the OutputStream to which the data is written
mode - either IXmlIO.BASE64 or IXmlOP.NORMAL. This indicates how a Data's xvals, yvals and errors are written
Returns:
true if successful otherwise false

NOTE: This routine writes all of the begin and end tags. These tag names are NOT TabulatedData but either HistogramTable or FunctionTable

XMLread

public boolean XMLread(java.io.InputStream stream)
Implements the IXmlIO interface so a Detector Position can read itself

Specified by:
XMLread in interface IXmlIO
Parameters:
stream - the InStream to which the data is written
Returns:
true if successful otherwise false

NOTE: This routine assumes the begin tag has been completely read. It reads the end tag. The tag names are NOT TabulatedData but either HistogramTable or FunctionTable
